item.title: Phillip add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Without friends, no one would want to live, even if he had all other goods." -- Aristotle

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Carol Shields
item.description: "Happiness is the lucky pane of glass you carry in your head. It takes all your cunning just to hang on to it, and once it's smashed you have to move into a different sort of life." -- Carol Shields

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "I see it all perfectly; there are two possible situations — one can either do this or that. My honest opinion and my friendly advice is this: do it or do not do it — you will regret both." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Phillip add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "The fields were fruitful, and starving men moved on the roads." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Phillip add a quote by William Shakespear
item.description: "There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so." -- William Shakespear

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I have the true feeling of myself only when I am unbearably unhappy." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Phillip add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I guess there are never enough books." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Nobody dies from the lack of sex. It's lack of love we die from." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Robert M. Pirsig
item.description: "When one person suffers from a delusion, it is called insanity. When many people suffer from a delusion it is called a Religion." -- Robert M. Pirsig

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Phillip add a quote by James Kelman
item.description: "Ninety-nine per cent of traditional English literature concerns people who never have to worry about money at all. We always seem to be watching or reading about emotional crises among folk who live in a world of great fortune both in matters of luck and money; stories and fantasies about rock stars and film stars, sporting millionaires and models; jet-setting members of the aristocracy and international financiers." -- James Kelman

item.title: Phillip add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Long books, when read, are usually overpraised, because the reader wishes to convince others and himself that he has not wasted his time." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Chinua Achebe
item.description: "Writers don't give prescriptions. They give headaches!" -- Chinua Achebe

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To become a spectator of one's own life is to escape the suffering of life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Christina Stead
item.description: "If all the rich people in the world divided up their money among themselves there wouldn't be enough to go around." -- Christina Stead

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Damon Galgut
item.description: "In his clearest moments he thinks he has lost the ability to love, people or places or things, most of all the person and place and thing that he is. Without love nothing has value, nothing can be made to matter very much." -- Damon Galgut

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Ludwig Wittgenstein
item.description: "Nothing is more important for teaching us to understand the concepts we have than to construct fictitious ones." -- Ludwig Wittgenstein

item.title: Phillip add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Phillip add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Somewhere embedded in every ordinary book are the five or six words for which really all the rest will be written." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Charles Darwin
item.description: "Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science." -- Charles Darwin

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "One of the great tragedies of mankind is that morality has been hijacked by religion. So now people assume that religion and morality have a necessary connection. But the basis of morality is really very simple and doesn't require religion at all." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "Cease, cows, life is short." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "Satan has his companions, fellow-devils, to admire and encourage him; but I am solitary and detested." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Unable are the loved to die. For love is immortality." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Christopher Reid
item.description: "Memories. Weighty emptinesses. I live in a memory the size and shape of a house." -- Christopher Reid

item.title: Phillip add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "If you're not careful, the newspapers will have you hating the people who are being oppressed, and loving the people who are doing the oppressing." -- Malcolm X
